org.semanticweb.rulewerk.parser

Class ParserConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.semanticweb.rulewerk.parser.ParserConfiguration
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultParserConfiguration

    public class ParserConfiguration
extends Object
    Class to keep parser configuration.
    Author:
    Maximilian Marx

    • Method Detail

      • registerDataSource

        public ParserConfiguration registerDataSource(String name,
                                              DataSourceDeclarationHandler handler)
                                       throws IllegalArgumentException
        Register a new (type of) Data Source. This registers a handler for some custom value of the DATASOURCE production of the rules grammar, corresponding to some DataSource type.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the data source, as it appears in the declaring directive.
        handler - Handler for parsing a data source declaration.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the provided name is already registered.
        See Also:
        the grammar

      • parseDataSourceSpecificPartOfDataSourceDeclaration

        public DataSource parseDataSourceSpecificPartOfDataSourceDeclaration(PositiveLiteral declaration)
                                                              throws ParsingException
        Parse the source-specific part of a data source declaration. This is called by the parser to construct a DataSourceDeclaration. It is responsible for instantiating an appropriate DataSource type.
        Parameters:
        declaration - literal that specifies the type and parameters for this data source declarations
        Returns:
        the data source instance.
        Throws:
        ParsingException - when the declaration is invalid, e.g., if the data source is not known.

      • parseDatatypeConstant

        public Constant parseDatatypeConstant(String lexicalForm,
                                      String datatype,
                                      TermFactory termFactory)
                               throws ParsingException
        Parse a constant with optional data type.
        Parameters:
        lexicalForm - the (unescaped) lexical form of the constant.
        datatype - the datatype, or null if not present.
        termFactory - the TermFactory to use for creating the result
        Returns:
        the Constant corresponding to the given arguments.
        Throws:
        ParsingException - when the lexical form is invalid for the given data type.

      • isConfigurableLiteralRegistered

        public boolean isConfigurableLiteralRegistered(JavaCCParserBase.ConfigurableLiteralDelimiter delimiter)
        Check if a handler for this JavaCCParserBase.ConfigurableLiteralDelimiter is registered
        Parameters:
        delimiter - delimiter to check.
        Returns:
        true if a handler for the given delimiter is registered.

      • parseConfigurableLiteral

        public Term parseConfigurableLiteral(JavaCCParserBase.ConfigurableLiteralDelimiter delimiter,
                                     String syntacticForm,
                                     SubParserFactory subParserFactory)
                              throws ParsingException
        Parse a configurable literal.
        Parameters:
        delimiter - delimiter given for the syntactic form.
        syntacticForm - syntantic form of the literal to parse.
        subParserFactory - a SubParserFactory instance that creates parser with the same context as the current parser.
        Returns:
        an appropriate Constant instance.
        Throws:
        ParsingException - when no handler for the literal is registered, or the given syntactic form is invalid.

      • registerDatatype

        public ParserConfiguration registerDatatype(String name,
                                            DatatypeConstantHandler handler)
                                     throws IllegalArgumentException
        Register a new data type.
        Parameters:
        name - the IRI representing the data type.
        handler - a DatatypeConstantHandler that parses a syntactic form into a Constant.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when the data type name has already been registered.

      • registerLiteral

        public ParserConfiguration registerLiteral(JavaCCParserBase.ConfigurableLiteralDelimiter delimiter,
                                           ConfigurableLiteralHandler handler)
                                    throws IllegalArgumentException
        Register a custom literal handler.
        Parameters:
        delimiter - the delimiter to handle.
        handler - the handler for this literal type.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when the literal delimiter has already been registered.

      • registerDirective

        public ParserConfiguration registerDirective(String name,
                                             DirectiveHandler<KnowledgeBase> handler)
                                      throws IllegalArgumentException
        Register a directive.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the directive.
        handler - the handler for this directive.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when the directive name has already been registered, or is a reserved name (i.e., one of base, prefix, and source).

      • parseDirectiveStatement

        public KnowledgeBase parseDirectiveStatement(String name,
                                             List<Argument> arguments,
                                             SubParserFactory subParserFactory)
                                      throws ParsingException
        Parse a directive statement.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the directive.
        arguments - the arguments given in the statement.
        Returns:
        the (possibly updated) KnowledgeBase
        Throws:
        ParsingException - when the directive is not known, or the arguments are invalid for the directive.

      • setNamedNulls

        public ParserConfiguration setNamedNulls(boolean allow)
        Set whether to allow parsing of NamedNull.
        Parameters:
        allow - true allows parsing of named nulls.
        Returns:
        this

      • isParsingOfNamedNullsAllowed

        public boolean isParsingOfNamedNullsAllowed()
        Whether parsing of NamedNull is allowed.
        Returns:
        true iff parsing of NamedNulls is allowed.

      • getImportBasePath

        public String getImportBasePath()
        Get the base path for file imports.
        Returns:
        the path that relative imports will be resolved against.

      • setImportBasePath

        public ParserConfiguration setImportBasePath(String importBasePath)
        Set a new base path for file imports.
        Parameters:
        importBasePath - path that relative imports will be resolved against. If null, default to current working directory.
